intro: Ecbolium vasculosum, commonly known as the vascular bladder, is a unique plant characterized by its specialized structures called bladders. These bladders are modified leaves that serve as water storage organs, allowing the plant to thrive in arid environments. The plant belongs to the family Cephalotaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. Its botanical features include a short, woody stem and a cluster of bladders at the base. The bladders are typically green to reddish in color and can vary in size depending on environmental conditions.
